page.title: 16Home Computers in Maltby
page.content: Home computers bought by families in Maltby are a new phenomenon in the 1980's. 25% of families have a computer. The two most popular computers are the cheap Sinclair Spectrum at 37% and the Commodore at 27%. There were nine other computer makes used in Maltby. Of accessories to computers, games were most popular with 30%,followed by tape recorders at 25% and joysticks at 19%. Few have bought monitors,interfaces,printers and disc drives. The cost of computers range from Â£150 to Â£1000. 27% of computers cost less than Â£150,19% between Â£300 and Â£600,only 1% cost over Â£1000. Playing games and programming are the most popular uses at 47% and 16%. Other uses were to keep data. The people tht make most use of computers are children with 58% and husbands with 29%.
